review_title: So much wrong but the people make it right
pros:
Most of the co-workers have a deep commitment to their work even though the glow of working for a non-profit on "laudable goals" has worn off rather quickly.
Slow pace of Higher Education coupled with Non-Profit, so much of the "effort" required to do your job is done at a snails pace.
We're empirically successful, driven tuition costs world-wide since the mid-90s; so that's something.
cons:
If you work in technology this position is a killer - no advancement opportunities at the higher education source for information IT related.
Management is distributed outside of the office causing a terrible disconnect between them and their subordinates.
Over inflated idea of the organization's own importance.
Has a negative impact on the higher education community

job_title: Office Administrator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Remote work opportunities promotes work-life balance
cons: A position was posted on a Tuesday.  I applied the following Monday.  One month later the job site STILL shows the application window open - as "closing soon”, yet, I was sent a rejection letter stating they "received a fair number of applications by the time I applied {again, just 4 business days later} and are evaluating those early applicants and proceeding to interview them.  Should we need additional applicants, we will include yours in the next round."  What kind of an employer does this, especially one associated with Higher Education?  Common practice is to review ALL applicants upon closing of the application process, weed out those that do not meet the desired qualifications, and then begin the interview selection process.  Why on earth would they basically throw out any or all potential well-qualified candidates simply because they received “a fair number already”?!?  Sketchy to say the least.

pros: Every single person on my team and in my division is very smart, kind, and dedicated to their jobs and to helping our members.  I'm also very pleased with the work-life balance and flexibility to work the hours I choose. My line manager is fantastic, providing support and help when I need it but remaining appropriately hands-off when it comes to the details of my day-to-day work.  The vibe in the Louisville office is pleasant and relaxed; the space itself is nice and modern.
cons: About half of the employees work remotely from home, in different states. This can be cool because we have a pretty active just-for-fun employee messaging channel to get to know each other, but also, as someone who works out of the CO office it can feel isolating sometimes. This is probably even more true for those who work remotely.

review_title: Stay as far away from this place as you can!
pros:
-Great people in the Louisville office
-Decent pay and benefits
-Nice location
-Some travel
cons:
-The President and Executives are completely oblivious to the Louisville office as they are distributed.
-Employees are bullied by supervisors.
-Huge employee turnover.
-Toxic/negative environment as most are unhappy and complain about it.
-So many unproductive meetings that their is no time to do your job.
-None of the departments work cohesively toward a common goal. This is directly due to the department directors and executives not working together.
-Lots of promises that do not come to fruition.
-Many extra hours of work required to get your job done.
-Terrible human resource department that is not fair and unbiased.

review_title: Work with mission-driven, motivated, collaborative colleagues
pros: The people!  Our members are the best and our co-workers are fun, motivated, intelligent, and committed to serving our members.  Every person I work with is engaged and excited about our work.  Our culture fully supports our distributed workforce.  Retirement and vacation benefits are fantastic.  Our events are always in interesting cities with interesting people.
cons: Communication can be a challenge in our fast-paced, distributed environment, but everyone is committed to assuming positive intent and moving forward in a positive way.  We've been using Slack to keep us connected in a professional and social way.  Even when we're far, we feel close now.

job_title: Business Intelligence Manager in Louisville, CO
pros: I’ve only worked here a couple of months but already I’m so glad to be here. Left a really toxic work environment and it’s refreshing to be here around people who obviously care about the mission. Remote work is valued alongside office work, which is great to see.
cons: So far, it’s been really good. No complaints, and the people are really great.
